intro: Rhexia incana, commonly known as the hairy leafspeed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Polemoniacaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Rhexia incana is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
